groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

request.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

source.description:
This protocol should be carried out in a clean environment. Use ethanol, RNAseZAP, DNA-OFF, or similar to prepare work bench before start.
Work quickly and preferably on
.
Prepare master-mixes right before use.
Use multichannel pipettes, liquid dispensers etc. to dispense the master-mixes. Avoid pipetting up and down, to minimize the loss of material.

Prepare lysis buffer mix
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Guanidine Hydrochloride (8000mM ; Optional)0mM - 50mM0.00--
3Poly-ethylene Glycol (50% solution)5%0.4044164
4Triton X-100 (10% solution)0.1%0.033.312.3
5ERCC spike-ins (Optional)----
6RNAse Inhibitor (40u/uL)0.5u/uL0.044.115.4
7OligodT30VN (100uM)0.5uM0.022.28.2
8dNTPs (25mM/each)0.5mM/each0.088.832.8
9Nuclease Free Water2.43267.6 997.3
10Total3 uL330 uL1230 uL
The lysis master-mix contains PEG! Ensure that PEG is fully mixed into solution, by either pipetting up and down until the liquid is clear, or start with vortexing the required master-mix volume of water and PEG together before adding the remaining reagents.
Add
lysis buffer to each well of a 96/384 well plate.
Quick centrifugation to collect the lysis buffer before storage until use.

ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Guanidine Hydrochloride (8000mM ; Optional)0mM - 50mM0.00--
3Poly-ethylene Glycol (50% solution)5%0.4044164
4Triton X-100 (10% solution)0.1%0.033.312.3
5ERCC spike-ins (Optional)----
6RNAse Inhibitor (40u/uL)0.5u/uL0.044.115.4
7OligodT30VN (100uM)0.5uM0.022.28.2
8dNTPs (25mM/each)0.5mM/each0.088.832.8
9Nuclease Free Water2.43267.6 997.3
10Total3 uL330 uL1230 uL

Sort single cells into
lysis in either 96 or 384 wells.
Seal with appropriate seals (-80 C to >100 C) and centrifuge the finished sorted plate immediately after, and transfer it to a
freezer or dry-ice.

While the plate is incubating as per step 4, prepare the following Reverse transcription master-mix.
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Tris-HCl pH 8.3 (1M)20mM0.11141
3NaCl (1M)30mM0.1213.249.2
4MgCl2 (100mM)2.5mM0.011.14.1
5GTP (100mM)1mM0.044.416.4
6DTT (100mM)8mM0.3235.2131.2
7RNase Inhibitor (40u/uL)0.5u/uL0.055.520.5
8TSO (100uM)2uM0.088.832.8
9Maxima H-minus RT enzyme (200U/uL)2u/uL0.044.416.4
10Nuclease Free Water0.2426.498.4
11Total1uL110uL410uL
Add
RT mix to each well of a 96/384 well plate.
Replace the storage seal with a PCR seal. Ensure that the plate is properly sealed, to avoid evaporation.
Do a quick centrifugation to collect reaction at the bottom, before incubating the plate in a thermocycler at;
ABC
142 °C90 min1x
250 °C2 min10x
342 °C2 min
485 °C5 min1x

ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Tris-HCl pH 8.3 (1M)20mM0.11141
3NaCl (1M)30mM0.1213.249.2
4MgCl2 (100mM)2.5mM0.011.14.1
5GTP (100mM)1mM0.044.416.4
6DTT (100mM)8mM0.3235.2131.2
7RNase Inhibitor (40u/uL)0.5u/uL0.055.520.5
8TSO (100uM)2uM0.088.832.8
9Maxima H-minus RT enzyme (200U/uL)2u/uL0.044.416.4
10Nuclease Free Water0.2426.498.4
11Total1uL110uL410uL

ABC
142 °C90 min1x
250 °C2 min10x
342 °C2 min
485 °C5 min1x

Start preparing the PCR mix, when the incubation of the reverse transcription reaction is near completion, by combining the following components.
! Note that the KAPA DNA polymerase has a 3-5' exonuclease activity that is not HotStart. Therefore add polymerase just before using the master-mix.
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Kapa HiFi HotStart buffer (5X)1X2.0220820
3dNTPs (25mM/each)0.3mM/each0.1213.249.2
4MgCl2 (100mM)0.5mM0.055.520.5
5Fwd Primer (100uM)0.1uM0.011.14.1
6Rev Primer (100uM)0.1uM0.011.14.1
7Polymerase (1U/uL)0.02U/uL0.22282
8Nuclease Free Water3.61379.11480.1
9Total6uL660uL2460uL
Add
PCR mix to each well of a 96/384 well plate.
Quick centrifugation to collect reaction at the bottom, before running the following PCR program in a thermocycler.
ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Initial denaturation98 °C3 min1x
3Denaturation98 °C20 sec18-25x
4Annealing65°C30 sec
5Elongation72 °C4 min
6Final Elongation72 °C5 min1x
7Hold4 °CHold

ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Kapa HiFi HotStart buffer (5X)1X2.0220820
3dNTPs (25mM/each)0.3mM/each0.1213.249.2
4MgCl2 (100mM)0.5mM0.055.520.5
5Fwd Primer (100uM)0.1uM0.011.14.1
6Rev Primer (100uM)0.1uM0.011.14.1
7Polymerase (1U/uL)0.02U/uL0.22282
8Nuclease Free Water3.61379.11480.1
9Total6uL660uL2460uL

ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Initial denaturation98 °C3 min1x
3Denaturation98 °C20 sec18-25x
4Annealing65°C30 sec
5Elongation72 °C4 min
6Final Elongation72 °C5 min1x
7Hold4 °CHold

Before purification prepare 22% PEG Clean-up Beads used for cleaning up the preamplified cDNA. These beads perform similar to Ampure XP beads. Beads are prepared as per mcSCRB-seq protocol
AB
1 ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 49 mL
9Total 49 mL
Add all ingredients into a
falcon tube, but do not add the total amount of water until after PEG is completely solubilized.
Incubate at
and vortex regularly until PEG is completely dissolved.
Resuspend bead stock carefully (Sera-Mag Speed Beads).
Pipette
of bead suspension into a 1.5 mL tube.
Place on magnet stand Remove supernatant.
Add
10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA (TE), and resuspend beads. Place on magnet stand.
Remove supernatant. Repeat wash one more time.
Add
10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA (TE), and resuspend beads.
Add to PEG solution above and mix well.

AB
1 ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 49 mL
9Total 49 mL

source.title: DNA concentration measurement and normalization (Optional, but recommended)

source.description:
1. Prepare 1X TE buffer by either diluting the 20X TE buffer from the QuantiFluor® dsDNA kit or by preparing a solution of 10mM Tris-HCl, 0.1mM EDTA, pH 8.
2. Dilute the QuantiFluor® dsDNA Dye 1:400 in 1X TE buffer and mix.
3. Prepare dsDNA standards for plate read-out, according to manufacturers protocol.
4. Dispense
/
per well of the ready Quantiflour dye mix into black, flat-bottom 384/96 well plates, respectively.
5. Add Standards to a separate plate.
6. Add
of cDNA to each well. Incubate asssay for
at
7. Use a plate reader, to measure fluorescence (504nM Excitation/ 531nM Emission) 8. Calculate cDNA concentration.
9. Calculate water needed to dilute
cDNA to
.

Remove the plate of sorted cells from the -80 freezer and incubate in a thermocycler with heated lid at
for
, followed by a
hold (keeping the storage seal sheet on the plate, unless damaged or loose).

ABCD
1 ReagentAmount (uL)Concentration in 4X
2Tris-HCl pH 7.5 (1M)4040mM
3MgCl2 (100mM)2020mM
4Dimethylformamide (DMF)20020%
5UltraPure Water740
6Total1000 uL
2. Prepare Tagmentation mix.
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Tagmentation buffer (4x)1X0.555205
3Amplicon Tagmentation Mix (Tn5)0.055.520.5
4UltraPure water0.4549.5184.5
5Total1uL110uL410uL
3. Dispense
of Tagmentation mix to a new 96 or 384 well plate.
4. Add
of normalized 200pg/uL cDNA (step 10) to the plate containing tagmentation mix.
5. Apply a quick spin-down of the plate before incubation in a thermocycler at
for
.
6. To strip off the Tn5 from the DNA, add
of 0.2% SDS to each well. Centrifuge quickly and incubate for
.
7. Concerning Nextera Index primers: We highly suggest to design or order custom Nextera Index primers. This ensures higher flexibility while also being much cheaper in the long run! The following protocol is designed as such. If using Nextera index primers purchased from Illumina, dilute all primers 5x with UltraPure water, and proceed to use similar volume as follows.
8. Add
Nextera Index primers to each well as follows
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction
2Custom S50X index primer (0.5uM)0.1uM0.75
3Custom N70X index primer (0.5uM)0.1uM0.75
9. Prepare Tagmentation PCR mix.
ABCDE
1ReagentReaction conc.uL per. reaction96 well plate384 well plate
2Phusion HF buffer (5X)1X1.4154574
3dNTPs (25mM/each)0.2mM/each0.066.223
4Phusion HF (2U/uL)0.01U/uL0.043.914.4
5H2O1.51166618.7
6Total3uL330uL1230uL
10. Add
of Tagmentation PCR mix to each well, centrifuge quickly and incubate in a thermocycler using the following PCR program.
ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Gap-filling72 °C3 min1x
3Initial denaturation98 °C3 min1x
4Denaturation98 °C10 sec12x
5Annealing55 °C30 sec
6Elongation72 °C30 sec
7Final Elongation72 °C5 min1x
8Hold4 °CHold

source.body: Dimethylformamide (DMF) should be handled in a fume hood and according to local safety regulations.

Check the cDNA library content and quality on a Agilent Bioanalzyer, using High Sensitivity DNA Analysis chips.

For the final library clean-up, pool all the Tagmented cDNA (step 12) sample wells in a 1.5mL or 5mL eppendorf tube.
1. Add 0.6:1 22% PEG beads to final volume of the pooled tagmentation cDNA. Mix gently by pipetting and incubate for
at
2. Place on magnet and allow beads to settle. Roughly
.
4. Discard supernatant, and wash twice with >=
freshly prepared 80% Ethanol.
5. Remove Ethanol and let the beads air dry for at least
6. Elute cDNA in
UltraPure Water, resuspend beads and incubate for
.

source.title: (Optional) Size selection via Gel-cutting and extraction

source.description:
To further select for longer tagmented fragments, an optional step including a size selection step can be included.
1. Load
of the eluted tagmented library from step 13 into a 2% Agarose E-Gel EX together with 50bp DNA ladder.
2. Run gel for
3. After finished run, open the gel casing and cut the gel between 550bp - 2kb using a clean scalpel or blade.
4. Purify the excised gel slice using Qiagen QIAquick Gel extraction kit according to manufacturers protocol.

The sequencing ready library should be sequenced on any Illumina compatible sequencer, either Single-end or Paired-end, depending on the question and need.
For final library whether gel cut/size selected or not, the expected median base-pair should be around or above 1kb. In our experience NovaSeq/HiSeq sequncers are more tolerant towards wider or longer size fragment distributions, than the NextSeq. Because of this consider increasing the loading concentration a bit to ensure proper cluster density. However "your milage may vary". Empircal investigation or a pilot run is always adviced, if possible.

After sequencing has completed successfully, binary base-call files (BCL) need to be converted to fastq.
For this, bcl2fastq should be used in the latest version (bcl2fastq v2.20).
At this stage, demultiplexing into per-cell fastq files is not necessary - a sample sheet is thus not needed.
Be sure to adjust the base mask to represent your sequencing layout and the length of your barcode reads.
Remove the option --no-lane-splitting if the same cell barcodes have been reused for different libraries on different lanes of the flow cell.
You may restrict the number of cores used with the following options:
--loading-threads
--processing-threads
--writing-threads
-R denotes the runfolder and you may redirect the fastq output to a different folder with the -o option.

After generating fastq files, the zUMIs pipeline should be used to process Smart-seq3 data to ensure correct handling of UMI reads and internal reads.
We recommend the newest version v2.5.6 at the time of this protocol.
All options are set in a configuration file following the YAML format. Here is a best practice example:
Be sure to use full paths to all files and folders. For further descriptions of the individual options visit the
zUMIs GitHub repository wiki
Now, simply start zUMIs with the following command:

source.name:
project: Smartseq3
sequence_files:
  file1:
    name: /smartseq3/fastq/Undetermined_S0_R1_001.fastq.gz
    base_definition:
      - cDNA(23-150)
      - UMI(12-19)
    find_pattern: ATTGCGCAATG
  file2:
    name: /smartseq3/fastq/Undetermined_S0_R2_001.fastq.gz
    base_definition:
      - cDNA(1-150)
  file3:
    name: /smartseq3/fastq/Undetermined_S0_I1_001.fastq.gz
    base_definition:
      - BC(1-8)
  file4:
    name: /smartseq3/fastq/Undetermined_S0_I2_001.fastq.gz
    base_definition:
      - BC(1-8)
reference:
  STAR_index: /resources/genomes/Mouse/STAR5idx_noGTF/
  GTF_file: /resources/genomes/Mouse/Mus_musculus.GRCm38.91.gtf
  additional_STAR_params: '--clip3pAdapterSeq CTGTCTCTTATACACATCT'
  additional_files:
    - /resources/genomes/spikes/ERCC92.fa
out_dir: /smartseq3/zUMIs/
num_threads: 20
mem_limit: 50
filter_cutoffs:
  BC_filter:
    num_bases: 3
    phred: 20
  UMI_filter:
    num_bases: 2
    phred: 20
barcodes:
  barcode_num: ~
  barcode_file: /smartseq3/expected_barcodes.txt
  automatic: no
  BarcodeBinning: 1
  nReadsperCell: 100
  demultiplex: no
counting_opts:
  introns: yes
  downsampling: '0'
  strand: 0
  Ham_Dist: 1
  write_ham: no
  velocyto: no
  primaryHit: yes
  twoPass: yes
make_stats: yes
which_Stage: Filtering
samtools_exec: samtools
pigz_exec: pigz
STAR_exec: STAR
Rscript_exec: Rscript

source.title: DNA concentration measurement and normalization (Optional, but recommended)

source.description:
1. Prepare normalization plate by adding the calculated water volumes to each well.
2. Add
of cDNA to each well.

Run the final library on a Agilent Bioanalyzer (High Sensitivity DNA), to inspect the quality and median base-pair length of your library.
Use Qubit fluorometer or similar to quantify the library.
Calcutate the final library concentration, using above metrics.
